pages.text: Aquaculture fish now follow TFC's climate rules. Each species has preferred water types, temperature ranges, and rainfall conditions. Fish yielding over $(thing)8 fillets$() are large fish and must be caught using large fishing bait.

Cold-sea species such as $(thing)Atlantic Cod, Blackfish, Halibut, Herring, Salmon, Pollock, Rainbow Trout$() spawn in oceans at $(thing)≤0°C$() with rainfall $(thing)≥75$() . Many of these fish are larger and yield more fillets.

Saltwater species such as $(thing)Jellyfish, Red Grouper, Tuna$() require salt water and temperatures of at least $(thing)0°C$() . $(thing)Tuna$() is especially large and must be caught using large fishing bait.
Freshwater fish such as $(thing)Smallmouth Bass, Bluegill, Brown Trout, Carp, Catfish, Gar, Minnow, Muskellunge, Perch$() spawn in fresh water at $(thing)0–20°C$() with no rainfall limits.
Arid-region fish such as $(thing)Bayad, Boulti, Capitaine, Synodontis$() prefer temperatures of $(thing)≥13°C$() and rainfall up to $(thing)300$() . They are common in warm, dry rivers.

Jungle species including $(thing)Arapaima, Piranha, Tambaqui, Arrau Turtle$() require dense jungle environments with temperatures of $(thing)15–30°C$() and rainfall $(thing)≥300$() . $(thing)Arapaima$() is a massive fish and must be caught using large fishing bait.
